subject: Mental Health
title: The Anti-Reward System
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Anti-Reward System.

hook.text: The brain doesn't just reward pleasure â€” it actively punishes its absence.

buildup.text: George Koob described the anti-reward system that creates misery during withdrawal.

discovery.text: Stress hormones like CRF surge while dopamine and serotonin crash simultaneously.

twist.text: Over time, the anti-reward system strengthens, making sobriety feel unbearable.

climax.text: Addicted people often use not to feel good but to stop feeling terrible.

punchline.text: The brain demands the drug by making life without it painful.

quiz.question: What drives continued substance use in late-stage addiction?
options: Avoiding withdrawal misery, not seeking pleasure
